content: I do not have information on the specific garage you are referring to. however, in general, a garage ventilation system is designed to remove harmful toxins, fumes, and excess heat from the parking area. it typically includes exhaust fans, intake vents, ductwork, and air filtration systems. the exhaust fans are usually mounted on the ceiling and are responsible for removing the contaminated air out of the garage. the intake vents are installed on the walls or the door to allow fresh air to enter the space. the air filtration system is an optional component that can be added to maintain the cleanliness of the apprised air.
